ie.gmit.dip

Class TextParser

  • java.lang.Object
    • ie.gmit.dip.Parser
      • ie.gmit.dip.TextParser
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IPrintable

    public class TextParser
extends Parser
implements IPrintable
    Implementation of the parser class. It is responsible for processing text from user input. Inherits from Parser and implements IPrintable. Class is not thread safe.
    Since:
    1.8
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Vladimir Novac
    See Also:
    Parser, IPrintable

      • loadInputText

        protected java.lang.String[] loadInputText(java.lang.String inputText)

      • processText

        protected java.lang.String[] processText(java.lang.String[] originalText)
        Loops through each word in the original text array and compares it to the thesaurus using compareText() method. Adds the result to a StringBuilder.
        Specified by:
        processText in class Parser
        Parameters:
        originalText - a String array with the user text line split into words.
        Returns:
        a String array with the processed text split into words.

      • compareText

        protected java.lang.String compareText(java.lang.String word)
        Compares the word from the user input to the thesaurus. If it finds a match, it replaces the word with the google equivalent. If it doesn't find a match, it returns the original word. To search inside the wordThesaurus treeMap is a O(log n) operation.
        Specified by:
        compareText in class Parser
        Parameters:
        word - a word from the user input text line.
        Returns:
        a new word if it finds a match or the same word if it doesn't.

      • printText

        private void printText(java.lang.String[] originalText,
                       java.lang.String[] processedText)
        Takes the original text and the processed text in String array form. Compares original text versus processed text word per word. If the word is unchanged, it gets printed using standard colour. If the word has changed, it is printed in red colour to show the change.
        Parameters:
        originalText - a String array with the user text line split into words.
        processedText - a String array with the processed text line split into words.
